title: Google Stadia gaming service will launch on November 19
text:
The release date has been revealed for Google Stadia (Picture: Google)

Google Stadia has been given an official November release date.

During the company’s Made By Google event in New York on Tuesday, Google hardware boss Rick Osterloh confirmed the game streaming service will launch on 19 November.

We previously knew the streaming service would release in November, but no exact release date had been released until now.

Stadia will launch across 14 territories on this date, including the US, UK and Canada, with at least 31 games from 21 different publishers available.

If you’re unfamiliar, the service allows you to play top-tier games like Borderlands 3 and Red Dead Redemption II on your TV, laptop, desktop, and certain phones and tablets.

The price for a one month subscription to Stadia is £8.99, but only those who pre-order the £119 Founder’s Pack will be able to use the service from day one.

The Founder’s Pack contains a three-month subscription (with a Buddy Pass for a friend), a Chromecast Ultra dongle (needed to get Stadia working on a TV), a limited edition Night Blue Stadia Controller, and the chance to get the Stadia Name (gamertag equivalent) you want before anyone else.

You’ll also get access to certain games and discounts, including Destiny 2: The Collection at launch.

These have since sold out and been replaced with the Google Stadia Premiere Edition, which is nearly identical outside a clear white controller instead of the night blue, and the absence of a Buddy Pass and exclusive Stadia usernames.

Founder’s Editions and Premiere Editions will begin shipping in the same order that pre-order were received.

The free to play version of Google Stadia, which won’t require a Chromecast, is expected to launch sometime next year.

description: Google have given an official release date to Google Stadia at their event in New York.
